title: ENG-394215: Verify Authservice flowing chrome and Microsoft edge
custom_steps:
https://netskope.atlassian.net/browse/ENG-394215





Problem description: 
Bing home page doesn’t load optimally with Cookie surrogate option enabled

with CEP (By default) or with IPSEC/GRE access method with Cookie surrogate enabled 

The page loads with improper alignment and over console we do notice lot of errors due to CSP violations 



Refused to apply inline style because it violates the following Content Security Policy directive: "default-src 'none' *.goskope.com". Either the 'unsafe-inline' keyword, a hash ('sha256-47DEQpj8HBSa+/TImW+5JCeuQeRkm5NMpJWZG3hSuFU='), or a nonce ('nonce-...') is required to enable inline execution. Note that hashes do not apply to event handlers, style attributes and javascript: navigations unless the 'unsafe-hashes' keyword is present. Note also that 'style-src' was not explicitly set, so 'default-src' is used as a fallback.

microsoft.2d3cc714516291217a17.js:292  Refused to apply inline style because it violates the following Content Security Policy directive: "default-src 'none' *.goskope.com". Either the 'unsafe-inline' keyword, a hash ('sha256-47DEQpj8HBSa+/TImW+5JCeuQeRkm5NMpJWZG3hSuFU='), or a nonce ('nonce-...') is required to enable inline execution. Note that hashes do not apply to event handlers, style attributes and javascript: navigations unless the 'unsafe-hashes' keyword is present. Note also that 'style-src' was not explicitly set, so 'default-src' is used as a fallback.
To Replicate: 
Open Edge via CEP access method, a new tab would result in the issue.
